creator: Bruce.Krautbauer@medtronic.com
text:
I have an SVG file that renders properly when viewed with the Adobe 3.0 viewer, 
with batik 1.5.1 squiggle and if included as an external-graphic it generates 
properly using fop.0.20.5.  If I run the same .fo and .svg through fop 1.0dev I 
see two sets of problems.  First, if there is a positive SVG translation being 
applied and stroke-opacity is 0 the marker position is off.  Second, if the 
translation is negative then both the line and marker positions are incorrect 
and if in addition stroke-opacity is 0 then the markers are not displayed at 
all.  I know it sounds a little weird.  The best thing is to run it and look at 
it.  Code attached.

creator: Bruce.Krautbauer@medtronic.com
text:
Created attachment 11445
source .fo that includes the .svg as an external-graphic

creator: Bruce.Krautbauer@medtronic.com
text:
Created attachment 11446
.svg source that shows the bug

creator: pascal.sancho@takoma.fr
text: Fixed in FOP 0.94 and probably earlier versions

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
